## Kodiak Bears: Giant Gentle Giants

Kodiak bears are huge brown bears living on islands off Alaska. They're one of the biggest bear species, even larger than grizzly bears. Despite their size, they eat and live like other brown bears, mostly hunting and scavenging.

People have hunted Kodiak bears for sport and protection for centuries. While they're not considered endangered, conservation efforts are important as more people move into their habitat. Scientists keep a close eye on Kodiak bear populations to make sure they stay healthy.
